hm.binkley.inject

Class Main<C extends org.aeonbits.owner.Config>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hm.binkley.inject.Main<C>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DemoMain

    public abstract class Main<C extends org.aeonbits.owner.Config>
extends Object
    Main is a sample guing together the Guice modules for a trivial application bootstrap. Applications extends Main and specify command line options with the template pattern. For a full-featured library see Governator.
    Author:
    B. K. Oxley (binkley)
    Pending:
    Rework with ServiceBinder, Inheritance is wrong here, try another approach

    • Constructor Detail

      • Main

        protected Main(@Nonnull
               Class<C> configType,
               @Nullable
               Main.DeclareOptions declare)
        Constructs a new Main. Use this form when mappings of command line options are one-to-one with properties configuration.
        Parameters:
        configType - the OWNER API config type, never missing
        declare - declare options, if any

      • Main

        protected Main(@Nonnull
               Class<C> configType,
               @Nullable
               String prefix,
               @Nullable
               Main.DeclareOptions declare)
        Constructs a new {code Main}. Use this form when command line options need a prefix to match properties configuration, e.g., "debug" on the command line is "my.app.debug" in properties.
        Parameters:
        configType - the OWNER API config type, never missing
        prefix - the optional prefix for command line options
        declare - declares options, if any

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String... args)
        Main entry point called by the JVM. Order of operation:
        1. Find the only implementation of Main via JDK service loader.
        2. Create a bootstrap injector to manage command line options with jopt-simple.
        3. Create the application injector with OWNER API for configuration.
        4. Include lifecycle support.
        5. Scan for annotated application modules.
        6. Inject the instance of Main triggering lifecycle events, if any.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments

      • addOptions

        protected abstract void addOptions(@Nonnull
                                   joptsimple.OptionDeclarer optionDeclarer)
        Configure command line parsing with JOpt-Simple.
        Parameters:
        optionDeclarer - the options parser, never mising
